  • Method Details

    • index

      @GetMapping({"/","/home"}) public java.lang.String index​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Display a view of the homepage, which gives an overview of the database. It also contains information about the products, categories, sellers, and customer dataset.
      Parameters:
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • products

      @GetMapping("/products") public java.lang.String products​(@RequestParam(value="page",defaultValue="0") int page, @RequestParam(value="sort",defaultValue="highToLow") java.lang.String sort, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Display the products and their prices on the products page. There is a filter that sorts the queries chosen by the user, whether if it's for displaying the best-selling items or products sorted by price. The list is limited to 20 items at a time and supports pagination.
      Parameters:
      page - the page number
      sort - a query filter
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • productView

      @GetMapping("/product") public java.lang.String productView​(@RequestParam("id") java.lang.String id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Display a single view of a product and list information information such as the minimum, maximum, and average price. This view also shows the average review score and list of customers interested in this product based on their order history.
      Parameters:
      id - the product id
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • categories

      @GetMapping("/categories") public java.lang.String categories​(@RequestParam(value="page",defaultValue="0") int page, @RequestParam(value="sort",defaultValue="highToLow") java.lang.String sort, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Displays categories along with their minimum, maximum, and average price values. It also contains a filter that sort queries that are chose from the user such as best-selling categories, average price from high to low and vice versa. It also displays certain information about the categories dataset, such as the number of items and the total average price of all categories.
      Parameters:
      page - the page number
      sort - a filter that sort queries chosen by users
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • categoryView

      @GetMapping("/category") public java.lang.String categoryView​(@RequestParam(value="page",defaultValue="0") int page, @RequestParam("id") java.lang.String id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Display a single view category page that list information about a single category such as the products sold in this category and the number of items sold.
      Parameters:
      page - the page number
      id - the category id
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • seller

      @GetMapping("/sellers") public java.lang.String seller​(@RequestParam(value="page",defaultValue="0") int page, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Display a list of sellers and show information about a seller such as the number of sales and items delivered.
      Parameters:
      page - the page number
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • sellerView

      @GetMapping("/seller") public java.lang.String sellerView​(@RequestParam("id") java.lang.String id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Display a single view page of a seller and information about a seller given an id. This page also list products sold by the seller, along with the delivered to undelivered ratio.
      Parameters:
      id - the seller id
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • customer

      @GetMapping("/customers") public java.lang.String customer​(@RequestParam(value="page",defaultValue="0") int page, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Display a list customers and information about the number of products bought and the total amount spent on the product.
      Parameters:
      page - the page number
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • customerView

      @GetMapping("/customer") public java.lang.String customerView​(@RequestParam("id") java.lang.String id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Display a single view of the customer page when given an id. This page shows a list of the nearest sellers and a list of products bought by the customer along with the total amount spent.
      Parameters:
      id - the customer id
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page

    • search

      @GetMapping("/search") public java.lang.String search​(@RequestParam("query") java.lang.String query, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Search for an id entered by the user. If an id is not found, it will redirect users to a not found page. If the id inputted by the user exist, it will find if the id is a product, seller, or customer. It will redirect users to a single view page given the id.
      Parameters:
      query - a given id from a user input
      model - model to be populated with related variables
      Returns:
      the html page
